etymology.description: 气(air; gas) + 泡(bubble; foam) = air bubble.
etymology.interpretation: Names a bubble of gas within a liquid or solid. Often seen in boiling water or carbonated drinks.
etymology.simplification: 氣 → 气 reduces strokes by streamlining the ‘steam/vapor’ components; 泡 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 水里升起许多气泡(水裡升起許多氣泡)。
examples.english: Many air bubbles rose in the water.

examples.chinese: 碳酸饮料里的气泡让人打嗝(碳酸飲料裡的氣泡讓人打嗝)。
examples.pinyin: Tànsuān yǐnliào lǐ de qìpào ràng rén dǎgé.
examples.english: The bubbles in a carbonated drink make people burp.

examples.chinese: 潜水员看到岩石缝隙冒出气泡(潛水員看到岩石縫隙冒出氣泡)。
examples.pinyin: Qiánshuǐyuán kàn dào yánshí fèngxì màochū qìpào.
examples.english: The diver saw air bubbles coming out of the rock crevices.
